page.title: 20Kelhead Quarry-3
page.content:
tyres for on of the excavators are over{6ft in diameter and cost Â£2000 each. Rock is taken from the quarry by lorry to markets in the local area.
Next to the modern quarry is the{old {Kelhead quarry}which produced agricultural lime. It closed in the 1920's and is now a{large picnic area. The old limestone burner is still there. The quarry has been turned into a lake with{Canada geese}and stocked with{fish for local anglers.}Swimming is not possible because the water is 90ft. deep, shelves rapidly and is very cold.
